titles.ar: كتاب الزِّيِّ وَ التَّجَمُّلِ وَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity

titles.ar: باب التَّجَمُّلِ وَ إِظْهَارِ النِّعْمَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 1 – The Beautification and the manifestation of the Bounty

titles.ar: باب التَّجَمُّلِ وَ إِظْهَارِ النِّعْمَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 1 – The Beautification and the manifestation of the Bounty

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ جَدِّهِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ اللَّهَ جَمِيلٌ يُحِبُّ الْجَمَالَ وَ يُحِبُّ أَنْ يَرَى أَثَرَ النِّعْمَةِ عَلَى عَبْدِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Qasim Bin Yahya, form his grandfather Al Hassan Bin Rashid, from Abu Baseer , 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> is Beautiful and Loves the beauty, and He<sup>azwj</sup> Loves that He<sup>azwj</sup> Sees the effects of the Bounties upon His<sup>azwj</sup> servants’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ رَفَعَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا أَنْعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَى عَبْدِهِ بِنِعْمَةٍ فَظَهَرَتْ عَلَيْهِ سُمِّيَ حَبِيبَ اللَّهِ مُحَدِّثاً بِنِعْمَةِ اللَّهِ وَ إِذَا أَنْعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَى عَبْدٍ بِنِعْمَةٍ فَلَمْ تَظْهَرْ عَلَيْهِ سُمِّيَ بَغِيضَ اللَّهِ مُكَذِّباً بِنِعْمَةِ اللَّهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Muhammad raising it, 
Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> has said: ‘When Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Favours upon His<sup>azwj</sup> servant with a Bounty, and he displays it (with thanks), he is named as a Beloved of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> narrating with a Bounty of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>; and when Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Favours upon a servant with a Bounty, so he does not display it (with thanks), he is named as the one being angry with Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, a denier in a Bounty of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ عُقْبَةَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ سَلَمَةَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ بَيَّاعِ الْقَلَانِسِ قَالَ مَرَّ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَلَى رَجُلٍ قَدِ ارْتَفَعَ صَوْتُهُ عَلَى رَجُلٍ يَقْتَضِيهِ شَيْئاً يَسِيراً فَقَالَ بِكَمْ تُطَالِبُهُ قَالَ بِكَذَا وَ كَذَا فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَ مَا بَلَغَكَ أَنَّهُ كَانَ يُقَالُ لَا دِينَ لِمَنْ لَا مُرُوءَةَ لَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Uqba Bin Muhammad, from Salma Bin Muhammad Baya’a Al Qalanasy who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> passed by a man who had raised his voiced upon a man requiring something small from him. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘With how much are you seeking it?’ He said, ‘With such and such’. So Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Has it nor reached you that it has been said that there is no Religion for the one who has no magnanimity (generosity) for him’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَمَّنْ رَوَاهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا أَنْعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَى عَبْدِهِ بِنِعْمَةٍ أَحَبَّ أَنْ يَرَاهَا عَلَيْهِ لِأَنَّهُ جَمِيلٌ يُحِبُّ الْجَمَالَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ali Bin Asbaat, from the one who reported, 
Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> has said: ‘When Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Favours upon His<sup>azwj</sup> servant with a Bounty He<sup>azwj</sup> Loves to See it upon him, because He<sup>azwj</sup> is Beautiful and Loves the beauty’.

verses.text: سَهْلُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ شَمُّونٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ مِسْمَعِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ أَبْصَرَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) رَجُلًا شَعِثاً شَعْرُ رَأْسِهِ وَسِخَةً ثِيَابُهُ سَيِّئَةً حَالُهُ فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مِنَ الدِّينِ الْمُتْعَةُ وَ إِظْهَارُ النِّعْمَةِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhamad Bin Al Hassan Bin Shamoun, from Abdullah Bin Abdul Rahman, from Misma’a Bin Abdul Malik, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> saw a man with dishevelled (untidy) hair of his head, and dirty clothes and in a bad state. So Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘From the Religion is the enjoyment and the manifestation of the Bounty’.

verses.text: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) بِئْسَ الْعَبْدُ الْقَاذُورَةُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
And by this chain, 
(Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>) said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The most evil servant is the filthy one’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ قَالَ رَآنِي أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ أَنَا أَحْمِلُ بَقْلًا فَقَالَ يُكْرَهُ لِلرَّجُلِ السَّرِيِّ أَنْ يَحْمِلَ الشَّيْ‏ءَ الدَّنِيَّ فَيُجْتَرَأَ عَلَيْهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from one of his companions, from Muawiya Bin Wahab who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saw me and I was carrying grass. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is disliked for the man of magnanimity that he should be carrying the lowly thing so they (people) would be audacious (disrespectful) towards him’.

verses.text:
عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ حَدِيدٍ عَنْ مُرَازِمِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى مَوْلَى آلِ سَامٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ النَّاسَ يَرْوُونَ أَنَّ لَكَ مَالًا كَثِيراً فَقَالَ مَا يَسُوؤُنِي ذَاكَ إِنَّ أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) مَرَّ ذَاتَ يَوْمٍ عَلَى نَاسٍ شَتَّى مِنْ قُرَيْشٍ وَ عَلَيْهِ قَمِيصٌ مُخَرَّقٌ فَقَالُوا أَصْبَحَ عَلِيٌّ لَا مَالَ لَهُ 
فَسَمِعَهَا أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) فَأَمَرَ الَّذِي يَلِي صَدَقَتَهُ أَنْ يَجْمَعَ تَمْرَهُ وَ لَا يَبْعَثَ إِلَى إِنْسَانٍ شَيْئاً وَ أَنْ يُوَفِّرَهُ ثُمَّ قَالَ لَهُ بِعْهُ الْأَوَّلَ فَالْأَوَّلَ وَ اجْعَلْهَا دَرَاهِمَ ثُمَّ اجْعَلْهَا حَيْثُ تَجْعَلُ التَّمْرَ فَاكْبِسْهُ مَعَهُ حَيْثُ لَا يُرَى وَ قَالَ لِلَّذِي يَقُومُ عَلَيْهِ إِذَا دَعَوْتُ بِالتَّمْرِ فَاصْعَدْ وَ انْظُرِ الْمَالَ فَاضْرِبْهُ بِرِجْلِكَ كَأَنَّكَ لَا تَعْمِدُ الدَّرَاهِمَ حَتَّى تَنْثُرَهَا 
ثُمَّ بَعَثَ إِلَى رَجُلٍ مِنْهُمْ يَدْعُوهُمْ ثُمَّ دَعَا بِالتَّمْرِ فَلَمَّا صَعِدَ يَنْزِلُ بِالتَّمْرِ ضَرَبَ بِرِجْلِهِ فَنُثِرَتِ الدَّرَاهِمُ فَقَالُوا مَا هَذَا يَا أَبَا الْحَسَنِ فَقَالَ هَذَا مَالُ مَنْ لَا مَالَ لَهُ ثُمَّ أَمَرَ بِذَلِكَ الْمَالِ فَقَالَ انْظُرُوا أَهْلَ كُلِّ بَيْتٍ كُنْتُ أَبْعَثُ إِلَيْهِمْ فَانْظُرُوا مَالَهُ وَ ابْعَثُوا إِلَيْهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Hadeed, from Murazam Bin Hakeym, from Abdul A’ala, a slave of the progeny of Saam who said, 
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> that, the people are reporting that for you<sup>asws</sup> is a lot of wealth’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘That does not bother me<sup>asws</sup>. One day Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> passed by some people from Qureysh, and upon him<sup>asws</sup> was a torn shirt. So they said, ‘The morning has come to Ali<sup>asws</sup> and there is no wealth for him<sup>asws</sup>’. 
So Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> heard that and he<sup>asws</sup> ordered the one who was in charge of his<sup>asws</sup> charities that he should gather his<sup>asws</sup> dates and do not send anything from these to the people and that these should be kept aside. Then he<sup>asws</sup> said to him: ‘Firstly sell these to the first one (buyer) and make these to be Dirhams. Then keep these where the dates were kept, and compress with it where it cannot be seen. He<sup>asws</sup> then said to the person in charge: ‘When I<sup>asws</sup> call you with the dates, so climb and look at the wealth, so strike it with you leg as if you have no intention for the Dirhams until you scatter these’.
Then he sent for a man from them, calling them over. Then he called for the dates. So when he climbed to descend with the dates, he struck with his leg and the Dirhams were scattered. So they said, ‘What is this O Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>!’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘This is wealth of the one who has no wealth for him<sup>asws</sup>’. Then he ordered with that wealth, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Look at the deserving ones of every house which I<sup>asws</sup> used to send to them’. So they looked at his wealth, and he<sup>asws</sup> sent it (to them)’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنِّي لَأَكْرَهُ لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَكُونَ عَلَيْهِ نِعْمَةٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ فَلَا يُظْهِرَهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, form Ibn Abu Umeyr, raising it, said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘I<sup>asws</sup> dislike it for the man that a Bounty happens to be upon him from Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, so he does not manifest it’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ جَدِّهِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) لِيَتَزَيَّنْ أَحَدُكُمْ لِأَخِيهِ الْمُسْلِمِ كَمَا يَتَزَيَّنُ لِلْغَرِيبِ الَّذِي يُحِبُّ أَنْ يَرَاهُ فِي أَحْسَنِ الْهَيْئَةِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Qasim Bin Yahya, from his grandfather Al Hassan Bin Rashid, from Abu Baseer, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Let one of you outfit for your Muslim brother just as he outfits himself for the stranger whom he loves that he should see him in a good state’.

verses.text:
عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ جَمِيعاً عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ بَلَغَ أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ طَلْحَةَ وَ الزُّبَيْرَ يَقُولَانِ لَيْسَ لِعَلِيٍّ مَالٌ قَالَ فَشَقَّ ذَلِكَ عَلَيْهِ فَأَمَرَ وُكَلَاءَهُ أَنْ يَجْمَعُوا غَلَّتَهُ حَتَّى إِذَا حَالَ الْحَوْلُ أَتَوْهُ وَ قَدْ جَمَعُوا مِنْ ثَمَنِ الْغَلَّةِ مِائَةَ أَلْفِ دِرْهَمٍ
فَنُشِرَتْ بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ فَأَرْسَلَ إِلَى طَلْحَةَ وَ الزُّبَيْرِ فَأَتَيَاهُ فَقَالَ لَهُمَا هَذَا الْمَالُ وَ اللَّهِ لِي لَيْسَ لِأَحَدٍ فِيهِ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَ كَانَ عِنْدَهُمَا مُصَدَّقاً قَالَ فَخَرَجَا مِنْ عِنْدِهِ وَ هُمَا يَقُولَانِ إِنَّ لَهُ لَمَالًا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Ibn Fazzal, altogether from Yunus Bin Yaqoub, from Abu Baseer who said, 
‘It (news) reached Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> that Talha and Al-Zubeyr were both saying, ‘There is not for Ali<sup>asws</sup>, any wealth’. He (the narrator) said, ‘So that was grievous upon him<sup>asws</sup>, so he<sup>asws</sup> ordered his<sup>asws</sup> representatives that they should gather his<sup>asws</sup> harvest until when a year passes by, to bring it to him<sup>asws</sup>, and there had gathered from the price of the harvest, one hundred thousand Dirhams. 
So he<sup>asws</sup> had it displayed in front of him<sup>asws</sup> and sent a messenger to Talha and Al-Zubayr. So he brought both of them to him<sup>asws</sup>. So he<sup>asws</sup> said to them both: ‘This wealth, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, is for me<sup>asws</sup>, there not being a share for anyone else in it’, and they had both verified it’. So they both left from his<sup>asws</sup> presence, and they were both saying, ‘He<sup>asws</sup> does have wealth for him<sup>asws</sup>’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ وَ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ أُنَاساً بِالْمَدِينَةِ قَالُوا لَيْسَ لِلْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) مَالٌ فَبَعَثَ الْحَسَنُ ( عليه السلام ) إِلَى رَجُلٍ بِالْمَدِينَةِ فَاسْتَقْرَضَ مِنْهُ أَلْفَ دِرْهَمٍ وَ أَرْسَلَ بِهَا إِلَى الْمُصَدِّقِ وَ قَالَ هَذِهِ صَدَقَةُ مَالِنَا فَقَالُوا مَا بَعَثَ الْحَسَنُ ( عليه السلام ) بِهَذِهِ مِنْ تِلْقَاءِ نَفْسِهِ إِلَّا وَ لَهُ مَالٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Ibn Fazzal, and Ibn Mahboub, from Yunus Bin Yaqoub, from Abu Baseer, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The people in Al-Medina were saying, ‘There is no wealth for Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>’. So Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> sent for a man of Al-Medina and borrowed a thousand Dirhams from him, and sent with it to the governor and said: ‘This is a charity of our<sup>asws</sup> wealth’. So they said, ‘Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> would not have sent this from himself<sup>asws</sup> except that there was indeed wealth for him<sup>asws</sup>’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ حَدِيدٍ عَنْ مُرَازِمِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى مَوْلَى آلِ سَامٍ قَالَ إِنَّ عَلِيَّ بْنَ الْحُسَيْنِ ( عليه السلام ) اشْتَدَّتْ حَالُهُ حَتَّى تَحَدَّثَ بِذَلِكَ أَهْلُ الْمَدِينَةِ فَبَلَغَهُ ذَلِكَ فَتَعَيَّنَ أَلْفَ دِرْهَمٍ ثُمَّ بَعَثَ بِهَا إِلَى صَاحِبِ الْمَدِينَةِ وَ قَالَ هَذِهِ صَدَقَةُ مَالِي .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Ali Bin Jadeed, from Murazam Bin Hakeym, from Abdul A’ala, a slave of the progeny of Saam who said, 
‘The state of Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup> was extremely difficult until the people of Al-Medina were discussing it. So that reached him<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> designated a thousand Dirhams, then sent with these to the governor of Al-Medina and said: ‘This is a charity from my<sup>asws</sup> wealth’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ أَبِي شُعَيْبٍ الْمَحَامِلِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي هَاشِمٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يُحِبُّ الْجَمَالَ وَ التَّجَمُّلَ وَ يُبْغِضُ الْبُؤْسَ وَ التَّبَاؤُسَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Abu Shuayb Al Mahamily, from Abu Hashim, from one of our companions, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Loves the beauty, and the beautification, and Hates the misery and the wretchedness’.

verses.text:
مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَسْلَمَ عَنْ هَارُونَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ بُرَيْدِ بْنِ مُعَاوِيَةَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) لِعُبَيْدِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ إِظْهَارُ النِّعْمَةِ أَحَبُّ إِلَى اللَّهِ مِنْ صِيَانَتِهَا فَإِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَتَزَيَّنَ إِلَّا فِي أَحْسَنِ زِيِّ قَوْمِكَ 
قَالَ فَمَا رُئِيَ عُبَيْدٌ إِلَّا فِي أَحْسَنِ زِيِّ قَوْمِهِ حَتَّى مَاتَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Muhammad Bin Aslam, from Haroun Bin Muslim, from Bureyd Bin Muawiya who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said to Ubeyd Bin Ziiyad: ‘Manifestation of the Bounty is more beloved to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> than its maintenance, so beware that you should not be outfitting except in the best of outfits of your people’. 
He (the narrator) said, ‘So Ubdeyd was not seen except in the best of outfits of his people until he died’.
